description: Construction of a two storey (two bedroom) single family dwellinghouse with associated landscaping and alterations to openings on the original dwelling at 35 Brent Road.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.    Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Site Location Plan, Property No. 37 Existing Ground Floor Plan, Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Property No 37 Existing First Floor Plan, Proposed First Floor Plan, Existing & Proposed Front Elevation, Existing & Proposed Side Elevation Rev B, Existing and Proposed Rear Elevation, Property No. 37 Existing Roof Plan, Proposed Roof Plan, received 19th December 2013, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.     Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.      Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E or F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions to the dwellings hereby approved or outbuildings shall be erected without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of the residents of adjoining properties and the dwelling hereby approved and the visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | The parking spaces for the development shall be laid out in accordance with the approved plans and shall be retained thereafter and used solely for the parking of cars clear of the highway and shall not be used for any other purposes, unless otherwise agreed in writing  by the local planning authority. One of the parking spaces shall be for the sole use of the existing dwelling at 35 Brent Road and the other space shall be for the sole use of the proposed dwelling.   Reason: To ensure that the proposed development and the existing dwelling at 35 Brent Road have off-street car parking, in the interests of highway safety, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; policies 6.1, 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise. The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms.  The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the amenity of future occupiers, in accordance with policy 7A of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration'; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy 7.15 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of planting for two trees onsite, details of boundary treatments and details of refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation of the development. The provision of refuse and recycling, boundary treatments and tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and thereafter retained and maintained in perpetuity. Any trees, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the planting shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to ensure appropriate refuse/recycling provision is provided for occupants of the dwelling hereby permitted, in accordance with policies 7D of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; policies 5.16, 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
